name: Introduction to Logic
description: This course introduces students to the basic concepts and principles of logic, including propositional and predicate logic, inductive reasoning, and logical fallacies.

name: Introduction to Set Theory
description: This course introduces students to the basic concepts and principles of set theory, including sets, subsets, functions, relations, and cardinality.

name: Intermediate Logic
description: This course builds upon the concepts and principles introduced in Introduction to Logic, including metalogic, modal logic, and higher-order logic.

name: Abstract Algebra
description: This course introduces students to the basic concepts and principles of abstract algebra, including groups, rings, fields, and vector spaces.

name: Advanced Logic
description: This course covers advanced topics in logic, including non-classical logics, proof theory, and model theory.

name: Real Analysis
description: This course introduces students to the basic concepts and principles of real analysis, including limits, continuity, differentiation, and integration.

name: Topological Spaces
description: This course introduces students to the basic concepts and principles of topological spaces, including open sets, closed sets, and continuity.
